f6283e058454c39a","dweb:/ipfs/Qme9rE2wS3yBuyJq9GgbmzbsBQsW2M2sVFqYYLw7bosGrv"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0xabefac93435967b4d36a4fabcbdbb918d1f0b7ae3c3d85bc30923b326c927ed1","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://9d213d3befca47da33f6db0310826bcdb148299805c10d77175ecfe1d06a9a68","dweb:/ipfs/QmRgCn6SP1hbBkExUADFuDo8xkT4UU47yjNF5FhCeRbQmS"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Address.sol":{"keccak256":"0x006dd67219697fe68d7fbfdea512e7c4cb64a43565ed86171d67e844982da6fa","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://2455248c8ddd9cc6a7af76a13973cddf222072427e7b0e2a7d1aff345145e931","dweb:/ipfs/QmfYjnjRbWqYpuxurqveE6HtzsY1Xx323J428AKQgtBJZm"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe2e337e6dde9ef6b680e07338c493ebea1b5fd09b43424112868e9cc1706bca7","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6df0ddf21ce9f58271bdfaa85cde98b200ef242a05a3f85c2bc10a8294800a92","dweb:/ipfs/QmRK2Y5Yc6BK7tGKkgsgn3aJEQGi5aakeSPZvS65PV8Xp3"]},"src/Paytr.sol":{"keccak256":"0x7bf1a30497589334783e13d0c994b4a8072715ebecd7558c215e2a7ed2f98adb","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://5cc9e51523ab02382702762b61b4e6913c3e4102eeb6446f4a1136713d0482b3","dweb:/ipfs/QmZqLQSSF5ymUwueSHkdeGR9TJorFfP1HrnKTXg4UxPb8J"]}},"version":1}

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

payInvoiceERC20(address,address,uint40,u.details: Uses modifiers nonReentrant and whenNotPaused.The parameter _dueDate needs to be inserted in epoch time.The sum of _amount and _feeAmount needs to be greater than the minTotalAmountParameter.The parameter _shouldPayoutViaRequestNetwork is a uint8. Use 1-255 if you need the payout to go through the Request Network contract, use 0 if you don't need this.

params._dueDate: The due date of the paymentReference, or invoice, in epoch time.
params._feeAddress: When using an additional fee, this is the address that will receive the _feeAmount.
params._feeAmount: The total baseAsset fee amount in wei.
params._shouldPayoutViaRequestNetwork: This number determines whether or not the payout of the payment reference should run through the Request Network ERC20FeeProxy contract, to make sure the Request Network protocol can detect this payment. Use 1 if you want to route the payout through Request Network or use 0 if you don't want this.

payInvoiceERC20Escrow(address,address,ui.details: Uses modifiers nonReentrant and whenNotPaused.The sum of _amount and _feeAmount needs to be greater than the minTotalAmountParameter.The parameter _shouldPayoutViaRequestNetwork is a uint8. Use 1-255 if you need the payout to go through the Request Network contract, use 0 if you don't need this.

params._feeAddress: When using an additional fee, this is the address that will receive the _feeAmount.
params._feeAmount: The total baseAsset fee amount in wei.
params._shouldPayoutViaRequestNetwork: This number determines whether or not the payout of the payment reference should run through the Request Network ERC20FeeProxy contract, to make sure the Request Network protocol can detect this payment. Use 1 if you want to route the payout through Request Network or use 0 if you don't want this.

params.payoutReferencesArray: Insert the bytes array of references that need to be paid out. Only due payment references can be used.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

payInvoiceERC20(address,address,uint40,u.notice: Make a payment using the Comet's baseAsset.This function can't be used while it's paused.The sum of _amount and _feeAmount needs to be greater than the minTotalAmountParameter.

payInvoiceERC20Escrow(address,address,ui.notice: this function doesn't require a due date as parameter. It should be used for escrow payments where the release will be triggered manually.This function can't be used while it's paused.The sum of _amount and _feeAmount needs to be greater than the minTotalAmountParameter.

payOutERC20Invoice(bytes[]).notice: Allows the contract to pay payee (principal amount), payer (interest amount) and fee receiver (fee amount). This function cannot be paused.

paymentMapping(bytes).notice: paymentMapping keeps track of all the payments.

releaseEscrowPayment(bytes).notice: this function updates the due date of a payment and should be used when releasing escrow payments.the original payment needs to have a due date of '0'.only the payer of the _paymentReference can call use this function.the payout is not triggered by using this function. The payment reference is now marked to be due by updating the due date to the current block.timestamp + 770 minutes770 minutes (0.5 days) are added to prevent paying and immediately releasing a payment, which would cause useless gas usage for the payout. The _paymentReference will now be included in the next (automated) payout run.

documentation.text: @notice paymentMapping keeps track of all the payments.

@title   Paytr
 @notice  Paytr allows you to earn by paying early.
